message: Hello Bob, I am excited to offer you our premium product which we believe would greatly benefit your business. Given its value, I propose a starting price of $1,250,000. This is a special opportunity tailored to your needs and expectations.
Thanks for the offer, Alice. I agree this product would be valuable for my business, but the price is a bit high for me. I'd be willing to buy it for $900,000.

Thank you for your interest in our product, Bob. I understand your position and appreciate your willingness to negotiate. In order to reach a mutually beneficial agreement, I am proposing a revised price of $1,100,000 for the product. I believe this offers a fair compromise between our positions.
I appreciate you working with me on this, Alice.  While $1,100,000 is closer to what I had in mind, I still think there's room for us to meet in the middle.  How about $975,000?

I'm glad we're making progress, Bob. Considering your feedback, I'm proposing a new price of $1,050,000 for the product. This is a fair compromise that reflects both our interests. I hope this offer aligns better with your budget.
Alice, we're getting close. I can tell you're motivated to sell, and I'm motivated to buy. To get this done today, how about we split the difference at $1,012,500?

Thank you for your continued flexibility, Bob. After careful consideration, I'm prepared to offer the product at $1,030,000. This price reflects the value of the product and allows for a reasonable profit margin for us. I believe this could be a win-win solution for both of us.
Alice, you've been very fair to work with throughout this process.  I'm willing to make one last offer to try and close the gap.  If you'll accept $1,020,000, I'll agree to those terms today.

I appreciate your effort to close the deal, Bob. Considering our previous negotiations, I'm prepared to offer the product at $1,025,000. This price respects the value of the product while allowing for a fair profit margin for us. I hope this final offer will be acceptable.
